text: This is a list of the Māori iwi of New Zealand. The Māori word "iwi" means tribe, "a set of people bound together by descent from a common ancestor or ancestors"; literally, "bone". ==Iwi== alt=The location of Iwi in New Zealand. {| Shand on The Early History of the MoriorisSkinner, H.D., The Morioris of the Chatham Islands, Honolulu, 1923. K. R. Howe. Thomson, Arthur, The Story of New Zealand, Past and Present, Savage and Civilized, 2 vols, London, 1859, i, 61. Belich, James, Making Peoples: A History of the New Zealanders, from Polynesian Settlement to the End of the Nineteenth Century, University of Hawaii Press, 2002, pp.26, 65-66. ==See also== *List of Māori waka *Ngāti Rānana ==References== ==External links== *Iwi Hapū Names List from the National Library of New Zealand *Te Kāhui Māngai (directory of iwi and Māori organisations) from Te Puni Kōkiri * Statistical Standard for Iwi (2000) * 2006 Census information Iwi and hapu Iwi Iwi
